item.title: Google warns Salesloft breach impacted some Workspace accounts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google reports that the Salesloft Drift breach is larger than initially thought, warning that attackers also used stolen OAuth tokens to access Google Workspace email accounts in addition to Salesforce data. [...]

item.title: US targets North Korean IT worker army with new sanctions
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) has sanctioned two individuals and two companies associated with North Korean IT worker schemes that operate at the expense of American organizations. [...]

item.title: Google shares workarounds for auth failures on ChromeOS devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google is working to resolve authentication failures preventing users from signing into their Clever and ClassLink accounts on some ChromeOS devices. [...]

item.title: Malware devs abuse Anthropic’s Claude AI to build ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Anthropic's Claude Code large language model has been abused by threat actors who used it in data extortion campaigns and to develop ransomware packages. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Word will save your files to the cloud by default
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says that Word for Windows will soon enable autosave and automatically save all new documents to the cloud by default. [...]

item.title: Passwordstate dev urges users to patch auth bypass vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Click Studios, the company behind the Passwordstate enterprise-grade password manager, has warned customers to patch a high-severity authentication bypass vulnerability as soon as possible. [...]

item.title: Police seize VerifTools fake ID marketplace servers, domains
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The FBI and the Dutch Police have shut down the VerifTools marketplace for fraudulent identity documents after seizing servers in Amsterdam that hosted the online operation. [...]

item.title: MATLAB dev says ransomware gang stole data of 10,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: MathWorks, a leading developer of mathematical simulation and computing software, revealed that a ransomware gang stole the data of over 10,000 people after breaching its network in April. [...]

item.title: Shadow IT Is Expanding Your Attack Surface. Here’s Proof
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Intruder
item.description: Shadow IT isn't theoretical—it's everywhere. Intruder uncovered exposed backups, open Git repos, and admin panels in just days, all hiding sensitive data. Make your hidden assets visible before attackers do. [...]

item.title: TransUnion suffers data breach impacting over 4.4 million people
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Consumer credit reporting giant TransUnion warns it suffered a data breach exposing the personal information of over 4.4 million people in the United States, with BleepingComputer learning the data was stolen from it's Salesforce account. [...]

item.title: Storm-0501 hackers shift to ransomware attacks in the cloud
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft warns that a threat actor tracked as Storm-0501 has evolved its operations, shifting away from encrypting devices with ransomware to focusing on cloud-based encryption, data theft, and extortion. [...]

item.title: Experimental PromptLock ransomware uses AI to encrypt, steal data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat researchers discovered the first AI-powered ransomware, called PromptLock, that uses Lua scripts to steal and encrypt data on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems. [...]

item.title: FreePBX servers hacked via zero-day, emergency fix released
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Sangoma FreePBX Security Team is warning about an actively exploited FreePBX zero-day vulnerability that impacts systems with the Administrator Control Panel (ACP) is exposed to the internet. [...]

item.title: IT system supplier cyberattack impacts 200 municipalities in Sweden
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A cyberattack on Miljödata, an IT systems supplier for roughly 80% of Sweden's municipal systems, has caused accessibility problems in more than 200 regions of the country. [...]
